natural problem:
Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\]
natural solution: The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\

&= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}

&\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > 0"
and h3 : "sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))) {1..} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))) {1..}"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > 0"
and h3 : "sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))) {1..} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))) {1..}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Consider two positive real numbers, $a$ and $b$, with $a > b > 0$. The sum of the reciprocals of the products $(n*a - (n-1)*b) * (n*a - (n-2)*b)$, where $n$ ranges over the natural numbers, is equal to the reciprocal of the product $(a-b)*b$. Verify that this statement is true.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > 0"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > b"
and h3 : "sum (\<lambda>i. (1 / (i * a - (i - 1) * b) * (i * a - i * b))) {1..n} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > 0"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > b"
and h3 : "sum (\<lambda>i. (1 / (i * a - (i - 1) * b) * (i * a - i * b))) {1..n} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Assume $a$ and $b$ are positive real numbers such that $a > b$. The sum from $i=1$ to $n$ of the terms $\frac{1}{{ia - (i - 1)b} * (ia - ib)}$ is equal to $\frac{1}{(a - b)b}$. Confirm that $\frac{1}{(a - b)b}$ equals $\frac{1}{(a - b)b}$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n*a - (n-1)*b) * ((n+1)*a - n*b))) {0..<\<infinity>} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "sum (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n*a - (n-1)*b) * ((n+1)*a - n*b))) {0..<\<infinity>} = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Assume that $a$ and $b$ are real numbers such that $a > b$ and $b > 0$. Also assume that the infinite series $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(n*a - (n-1)*b) * ((n+1)*a - n*b)}$ is equal to $\frac{1}{(a - b) * b}$. Show that $\frac{1}{(a - b) * b}$ is equal to $\frac{1}{(a - b) * b}$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. f n = 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))"
shows  "suminf f = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. f n = 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))"
shows  "suminf f = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Given two real numbers $a$ and $b$ where $a > b > 0$, and a function $f(n) = \frac{1}{(n*a - (n-1)*b) * (n*a - (n-2)*b)}$ for all natural numbers $n$, find the sum of the infinite series defined by $f$. The final answer is $\frac{1}{(a - b) * b}$.

a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. 1/(b*a) + 1/(a*(2*a - b)) + 1/((2*a - b)*(3*a - 2*b)) + 1/((3*a - 2*b)*(4*a - 3*b)) + ... = 1/((a - b)*b)"
shows  "1/((a - b)*b) = 1/(b*a) + 1/(a*(2*a - b)) + 1/((2*a - b)*(3*a - 2*b)) + 1/((3*a - 2*b)*(4*a - 3*b)) + ..."
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given that $a > b > 0$, show that the infinite series $1/(b*a) + 1/(a*(2*a - b)) + 1/((2*a - b)*(3*a - 2*b)) + 1/((3*a - 2*b)*(4*a - 3*b)) + ...$ is equal to $1/((a - b)*b)$.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > 0"
and h3 : "(\<Sum>n\<in>{1..infinity}. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - n * b))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b)"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > 0"
and h3 : "(\<Sum>n\<in>{1..infinity}. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - n * b))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: The sum from n=1 to infinity of $\frac{1}{(n*a-(n-1)*b)*(n*a-n*b)}$ equals $\frac{1}{(a-b)*b}$. If a is greater than b, and both a and b are greater than 0, then what is the value of $\frac{1}{(a-b)*b}$?

a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > 0"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > b"
and h3 : "(\<Sum>n\<in>UNIV. 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * ((n + 1) * a - n * b))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / (b * a) + 1 / (a * (2 * a - b)) + 1 / ((2 * a - b) * (3 * a - 2 * b)) + 1 / ((3 * a - 2 * b) * (4 * a - 3 * b)) + ... = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: Given two positive real numbers $a$ and $b$ where $a > b$, prove that the infinite sum of the terms defined by $\frac{1}{(na - (n - 1)b)((n + 1)a - nb)}$ equals $\frac{1}{(a - b)b}$. In other words, show that $\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + ... = \frac{1}{(a - b)b}$.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > 0"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > b"
and h3 : "suminf (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n-1) * b) * ((n+1) * a - n * b))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = suminf (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n-1) * b) * ((n+1) * a - n * b)))"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > 0"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "a > b"
and h3 : "suminf (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n-1) * b) * ((n+1) * a - n * b))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "1 / ((a - b) * b) = suminf (\<lambda>n. 1 / ((n * a - (n-1) * b) * ((n+1) * a - n * b)))"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Assume $a$ and $b$ are real numbers such that $a > 0$, $b > 0$, and $a > b$. If the sum of the infinite series $\frac{1}{(n*a - (n-1)*b)*(n+1*a - n*b)}$ is equal to $\frac{1}{(a - b)*b}$, show that $\frac{1}{(a - b)*b}$ is equal to the sum of the infinite series $\frac{1}{(n*a - (n-1)*b)*(n+1*a - n*b)}$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. (\<Sum>i = 1..n. 1 / ((i*a - (i-1)*b) * (a*i - b*(i-1)))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "True"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. (\<Sum>i = 1..n. 1 / ((i*a - (i-1)*b) * (a*i - b*(i-1)))) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
shows  "True"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Given two positive real numbers $a$ and $b$ such that $a > b > 0$. If the sum from $i=1$ to $n$ of the terms $1 / ((i*a - (i-1)*b) * (a*i - b*(i-1)))$ equals $1 / ((a - b) * b)$ for all positive integers $n$, then this statement is true.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. f n = 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))"
shows  "(\<Sum>n. f n) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a$ and $b$ be positive real numbers, with $a > b.$  Compute
\[\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb.\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{(a - b)b}
 ### Proof
 The $n$th term is \[\frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]}.\]We can write \begin{align} \frac{1}{[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} &= \frac{a - b}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\
 &= \frac{[na - (n - 1) b] - [(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b]}{(a - b)[(n - 1) a - (n - 2) b][na - (n - 1) b]} \\ &= \frac{1}{(a - b)[(n - 1)a - (n - 2)b]} - \frac{1}{(a - b)[na - (n - 1)b]}. \end{align}Thus, \begin{align}
 &\frac{1}{ba} + \frac{1}{a(2a - b)} + \frac{1}{(2a - b)(3a - 2b)} + \frac{1}{(3a - 2b)(4a - 3b)} + \dotsb \\ &= \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)b} - \frac{1}{(a - b)a} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)a} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{(a - b)(2a - b)} - \frac{1}{(a - b)(3a - 2b)} \right) + \dotsb \\
 &= \boxed{\frac{1}{(a - b)b}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "a > b"
and h1 : "b > 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. f n = 1 / ((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))"
shows  "(\<Sum>n. f n) = 1 / ((a - b) * b)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Given two real numbers, $a$ and $b$, where $a > b$ and $b > 0$. A function $f(n)$ is defined for natural numbers as $f(n) = \frac{1}{((n * a - (n - 1) * b) * (n * a - (n - 2) * b))}$. Compute the sum of all values of $f(n)$. The final answer is $\frac{1}{((a - b) * b)}$.
